position.marginalia_text: Ca[e]tera nuga[e]. Sit prior loco, qui velit: dignitate, qui potest.

marginalia.translation: A serious accuracy in valitude, agility, and experience. The rest are trifles. Let he who wishes be first in place: let he who can, be first in dignity.

position.marginalia_text: In externo vigore Corporis, pra[e]sertim vultus, lucet internus valor. Semeiotica naturalis: vtcunq[ue]

marginalia.translation: Internal valor shines forth in the external vigor of the body, especially of the face. The signs of nature: where politics disguises.

position.marginalia_text: Cogenda valetuda, bonaq[ue] omnia pra[e]potentibus argumentis: vel similibus ad pra[e]seruandum; vel contrarijs ad restaurandum. sed proprijs, aut aptis.

marginalia.translation: All healthy and good things must be brought together in very powerful arguments: either in similar ones for preserving; or in contradictory ones for restoring. But in special or apt ones.

position.marginalia_text: Contrarijs curantur omnia: sed efficacibus, exquisiteq[ue] constantibus.

marginalia.translation: All things are taken care for with their contrary matters: but by effective and exquisite corresponding ones.

position.marginalia_text: Quò strictior in rerum substantijs; eò remissior in personaru[m] circu[m]stantijs.

marginalia.translation: The more restricted one is in the essence of things, the easier it will be in the circumstances of persons.

position.marginalia_text:
Fidem profiteor Monam non Monacham: aiebat
Astrophilus. Doctor gentium pro fide mona.

marginalia.translation: I declare one faith, not a solitary one, Astrophilus use to say. A doctor of the people is for one faith.
